fixes.name: Risk Date # of Days
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau row-level subtraction [RISK_DATE]-[EFFECTIVE_DATE] into a DAX calculated column by subtracting the two datetime columns in the same table. This preserves the row-level day difference as a numeric value.

fixes.name: Tenor ToH
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR yearRisk = YEAR('Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[RISK_DATE])
VAR bucketMode = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[BUCKET_MODE_IND]
VAR riskDays = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Risk Date # of Days]
RETURN
IF(
    yearRisk = 1980 && bucketMode = "PARALLEL",
    "Parallel",
    IF(
        riskDays <= 96, "0-3M",
        IF(
            riskDays <= 371, "3M-1Y",
            IF(
                riskDays <= 1102, "1-3Y",
                IF(
                    riskDays <= 2564, "3-7Y",
                    IF(
                        riskDays <= 4389, "7-12Y",
                        IF(
                            riskDays <= 7311, "12-20Y",
                            IF(riskDays > 7311, ">20Y", "Error")
                        )
                    )
                )
            )
        )
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau IF/ELSEIF logic into DAX using VARs for intermediate values (yearRisk, bucketMode, riskDays) and nested IFs for the tenor buckets. All column references were converted to the 'table'[column] format and string literals preserved.
